snippet: The German industrial giant suffered huge losses at the unit that operates steel plants in Brazil and Alabama and had to pay fines related to a price-fixing scandal.
abstract: Embattled German steel maker ThyssenKrupp reports largest loss in its history and confirms that three top executives will leave company; loss of 5 billion euros ($6.5 billion) for the fiscal year that ended in September caps tumultuous year for company that once symbolized German industrial might.
lead_paragraph: The German industrial giant suffered huge losses at the unit that operates steel plants in Brazil and Alabama and had to pay fines related to a price-fixing scandal.

headline.main: Embattled German Steel Maker Reports a Huge Loss
headline.print_headline: Embattled German Steel Maker Reports a Huge Loss
